metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3618 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
ALPACA is an application layer protocol content confusion attack,exploiting TLS servers implementing different protocols but usingcompatible certificates, such as multi-domain or wildcard certificates. AMiTM attacker having access to victim's traffic at the TCP/IP layer canredirect traffic from one subdomain to another, resulting in a valid TLSsession. This breaks the authentication of TLS and cross-protocol attacksmay be possible where the behavior of one protocol service may compromisethe other at the application layer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3618` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1

libnginx-mod-mail - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
nginx - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1
nginx-common - 1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1

No subscription required

vsftpd - 3.0.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.0-6ubuntu14.1').
vsftpd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.5-0ubuntu1').
sendmail package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and needs fixing.
